channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Bitcoin hits $80,000 for the first time as crypto traders bask in Trump election victory
item.description: Cryptocurrencies extended their rally on Sunday, with bitcoin touching $80,000 for the first time ever.

item.title: What Trump's mass deportation plan would mean for immigrant workers and the economy
item.description: President-Elect Donald Trump says his mass deportation plan will go ahead. Hiring firms and labor economists have begun to weigh the damage.

item.title: '#EndtheFed': Elon Musk endorses plan to let presidents meddle with Federal Reserve after Trump election win
item.description: During his first term as president, Donald Trump was not shy about publicly disparaging Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and his policy decisions.

item.title: Fed's Kashkari says Trump tariffs could reheat inflation if they provoke global trade 'tit for tat'
item.description: Donald Trump unleashed China tariffs during his first term that essentially sparked a trade war after the country retaliated with its own U.S. import taxes

item.title: The 2 things that will drive the stock market after last week's Trump-Fed rally
item.description: Talk about an eventful week. And, the hurdles to come.

item.title: American interest in moving abroad skyrockets after Trump's win — here's how many would actually leave
item.description: Google Trends showed searches related to "leaving the country" and "how to move to …" spiked following the news that Donald Trump is returning to the White House.

item.title: ‘Two-stocks’ are better than one? Repacking ‘pair trades'
item.description: How two-stock ETFs could transform pair trading for investors.

item.title: Painting the town pink and green: 'Wicked' takes over retail ahead of theatrical debut
item.description: Universal's "Wicked" is drumming up buzz ahead of its Nov. 22 release with hundreds of merchandise offerings from dozens of retail partners.

item.title: I'm a longevity researcher and doctor of functional medicine: Here’s what I do every day for a long, healthy life
item.description: Dr. Frank Lipman has over 35 years of experience in functional medicine, and now focuses on longevity. Here are his daily practices for a longer, happier life.

item.title: To influence people, make 3 simple changes to how you talk, says executive coach: Success 'depends on your ability to persuade'
item.description: "The ability to influence others can set you up for success" at work, says Melody Wilding, so that you can advance more easily and have more of an impact.

item.title: Top German business leader recalls his days working with Trump: 'His administration was extremely receptive'
item.description: It is uncertain what Donald Trump's second presidency will look like, but his first administration was highly responsive to business issues, Joe Kaeser said.

item.title: 5 in-demand low-stress jobs — they all pay over $100,000 and help the environment
item.description: Many low-stress, high-paying jobs are found in the sustainability sector.

item.title: How to say 'no' when family and friends ask to borrow money, from a financial therapist
item.description: Here's one way to set financial boundaries with friends or family members and how to manage guilt when you need to say no, according to a financial therapist.

item.title: 'It's gross, it's unprofessional': Some LinkedIn users are being put off the platform by unsolicited flirtatious DMs
item.description: A LinkedIn spokesperson told CNBC Make It that the platform — which was launched in 2003 and now has over 1 billion members globally — defines itself as a "professional community."

item.title: China announces $1.4 trillion package over five years to tackle local governments' 'hidden' debt
item.description: Authorities in Beijing have ramped up stimulus announcements since late September in an effort to bolster its flagging economy.

item.title: ChatGPT rejected more than 250,000 image generations of presidential candidates prior to Election Day
item.description: OpenAI estimates that ChatGPT rejected more than 250,000 requests to generate images of the 2024 U.S. presidential candidates in the lead up to Election Day.

item.title: Europe cannot finance Ukraine war if Trump pulls U.S. out of the conflict, Hungary's Orban warns
item.description: Ukraine has historically depended on foreign humanitarian and military aid to resist Russia's two-year invasion, with the U.S. and the EU providing the lion's share of this assistance.

item.title: How Black business leaders are thinking about a coming Trump administration
item.description: Black business leaders are weighing why Vice President Kamala Harris lost the presidential race, and how to approach President-elect Donald Trump.

item.title: China's stimulus plans are choking the profitability of its megabanks, analysts say
item.description: The country's banking industry has grappled with weakening profitability under the weight of lower mortgage rates and ailing credit demand.

item.title: Sony raises guidance on gaming strength, quarterly operating profit beats estimates
item.description: Sony raised sales guidance for the full year and posted operating profit that smashed analyst expectations after a strong quarter for its gaming business.

item.title: Nissan shares plunge over 10% after downbeat quarterly results, production-cut plans
item.description: The automaker posted disappointing second-quarter results and announced reductions in production and staff.

item.title: How Samsung fell behind in the AI boom leading to a $126 billion wipeout
item.description: Samsung Electronics has fallen behind long-time rival SK Hynix in the area of high-bandwith memory.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: How will the next Trump administration impact India?
item.description: India is likely to have both winners and losers if President-elect Donald Trump chooses to enact trade tariffs, cut corporation tax, immigration and subsidies.

item.title: Top trader Vitol eyeing metals market as global oil demand set to peak in 10 years, CEO signals
item.description: In contrast to the eventual decline of the crude industry, metals business is going to witness a "great deal of growth," CEO Russell Hardy said.

item.title: Powell says he would not resign as Fed chief if Trump asked for his resignation
item.description: When asked whether he would resign if asked by Trump, the Fed chair simply said: "No."

item.title: Federal Reserve cuts interest rates by a quarter point
item.description: The Federal Reserve approved its second consecutive interest rate cut Thursday.

item.title: What Trump’s historic election victory means for the global economy
item.description: The former president's litany of pledges include steep tariffs, tax cuts, deregulation and a push to withdraw from key global agreements.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Powell emphasizes that elections won't sway Fed's policy
item.description: If inflation resurfaces because of the incoming administration's policies, the Fed’s likely to stay its hand in lowering rates.

item.title: Trump likely to uphold CHIPS Act despite his campaign rhetoric, policy experts say
item.description: President elect Donald Trump is unlikely to roll back the Biden administration’s CHIPS and Science Act, despite his campaign rhetoric on the bill, experts say.

item.title: DoubleLine's Gundlach says expect higher rates if Republicans also win the House
item.description: DoubleLine's Jeffrey Gundlach said interest rates could shoot higher if Republicans end up controlling the House and securing a governing trifecta.
